title: Genoise Sponge Recipe
description: Genoise sponge is a classic European cake made with whipped egg whites. It has a nice buttery color and a fairly firm texture making it perfect for layer cakes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Sponge Cake Recipes Genoise Sponge 4.8 (4) 3 Reviews 4 Photos This Genoise sponge is perfect for a special occasion. Top with fruit and cream or layer with your favorite frosting. Submitted by Carol Updated on August 16, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 14 Yield: 1 (10-inch) cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 14 servings 6 large egg whites ½ teaspoon cream of tartar ¾ cup white sugar 1 cup butter, softened 1 cup white sugar 6 large egg yolks 2 cups sifted cake flour ½ teaspoon baking powder ½ teaspoon salt Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch cake pan. Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until soft peaks form. Add 3/4 cup sugar gradually, beating until very stiff. Cream butter and 1 cup sugar in a large bowl with an electric beater until light in color. Add egg yolks, and beat until thick and fluffy. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt over batter; fold in. Gently fold in egg whites. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 50 to 60 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely. name: Carol
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch cake pan.;Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until soft peaks form. Add 3/4 cup sugar gradually, beating until very stiff.;Cream butter and 1 cup sugar in a large bowl with an electric beater until light in color. Add egg yolks, and beat until thick and fluffy. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt over batter; fold in. Gently fold in egg whites. Pour batter into prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 50 to 60 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
